messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Inroverts/Extroverts
messages.msgSnippet: Sounds like DH s father s family.  Tha annual family reunion .....is interesting.  The count was higher, for a while, but as they age and pass over.... of
messages.messageBody:
Sounds like DH's father's family. Tha annual family
"reunion".....is interesting. The count was higher,
for a while, but as they age and pass over....
of course, we get to hear more "stories" with some
family members not present...and me only being in the
family by marraige, I get to hear more :-) as it is
not assumed that I already know. But intoverts all.
They eat, visit two hours, and run away. Poof. Gone.

Sharon of the Swamp

--- GSmith8995@... wrote:
> My husband comes from a family of 11. They are all
> introverts. None of them
> like to be around crowds and the biggest crowd any
> of them tolerate (on
> occasion) is holidays at their parents. Big
> holidays like Christmas bring in
> at least 50 people, (brothers, sisters, their
> children, in-laws, outlaws,
> etc..........). Things can get very interesting!
>
> Joy
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Inroverts/Extroverts (was Comfort for a friend)
messages.msgSnippet: My husband comes from a family of 11.  They are all introverts.  None of them like to be around crowds and the biggest crowd any of them tolerate (on occasion)
messages.messageBody:
My husband comes from a family of 11. They are all introverts. None of them
like to be around crowds and the biggest crowd any of them tolerate (on
occasion) is holidays at their parents. Big holidays like Christmas bring in
at least 50 people, (brothers, sisters, their children, in-laws, outlaws,
etc..........). Things can get very interesting!

Joy
